body:
### Describe the bug

Why does it now think that this function's signature has `PY_LONG_LONG` in it instead of `uint64_t`?
```python
from xpra.server.window.motion import ScrollData
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
  File "xpra/server/window/motion.pyx", line 1, in init xpra.server.window.motion
TypeError: C function xpra.buffers.xxh.xxh3 has wrong signature (expected unsigned PY_LONG_LONG (void const *, size_t), got uint64_t (void const *, size_t))
```

### Code to reproduce the behaviour:

A tiny [XXH3 wrapper](https://github.com/Xpra-org/xpra/blob/master/xpra/buffers/xxh.pyx) is `cimport`ed from another module using `from xpra.buffers.xxh cimport xxh3`:
https://github.com/Xpra-org/xpra/blob/e735e6a3bdf17c3299f78948a10fd45f2d8f4c77/xpra/server/window/motion.pyx#L16

### Expected behaviour

This used to work just fine with previous versions, the function can be imported and used without problems.

### Environment

OS: reproduced on Linux, not tested others
Python version 3.10.10
Cython version 3.0.0b1


### Additional context

_No response_
title: [BUG] TypeError: C function has wrong signature - 3.0.0b1 regression
